Posted By: TheWrathofShane (9/4/2012 10:55:23 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I do like how she's clearly showing the strain of all the demon hunting and so forth. Before she was all mischievous and curvy, and now she's becoming worn, gaunt and moody. She'll probably hit full-on lichdom by her next iteration.  
  
Card-wise, tutoring up a land constantly is nice for deck thinning, though that ultimate is only good for a really powerful X spell. But the middle ability always has uses - look at [Ajani Vengeant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani Vengeant), and the up and coming [Ral Zarek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ral Zarek).
posts.html:
I do like how she's clearly showing the strain of all the demon hunting and so forth. Before she was all mischievous and curvy, and now she's becoming worn, gaunt and moody. She'll probably hit full-on lichdom by her next iteration.

Posted By: adrian.malacoda (9/19/2012 11:21:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I was never a Liliana fan, then I saw this card in the spoiler and knew it was love. She takes care of me. At first it was enough to just get a swamp each turn. I liked not having to worry about weather or not I will get land, and hey this is *card advantage*, that sacred thing dreams are made of.  
  
The thing about this card is, she provides four services, 1. Card advantage. 2. Removes land from your deck. 3. She can kill creatures. and 4. Her ultimate Provides almost limitless mana, enough to fuel any black combo.   
  
Most importantly is that her +1 is good, really good. I hate relying on a planeswalker's ultimate to justify them, it just won't always happen. Good players know to stop these things and are prepared. But Liliana is cheap and all her abilities are good.

Posted By: mdakw576 (7/4/2013 4:16:02 AM)

posts.post_content:
Love this card. I prefer planeswalkers being balanced and not simply the best cards to have. They are always going to be cool so long as you don't make them suck, but they don't need to be brokenly overpowered or made into a staple card for the colour.  
  
I use this in my [Vish Kal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vish Kal) EDH deck which is almost mono black to make use of [cabal coffers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cabal coffers) and black-heavy card draw like [necropotence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=necropotence).  
  
If I ever combine this card's -6 ability with [debt to the deathless](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=debt to the deathless), it will be glorious.  
  
@MattLynn  
Why not [sorin markov](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sorin markov) (-3 ability) + [sorin's vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sorin's vengeance)? That way, you can even stay in mono black.
posts.html:
Love this card. I prefer planeswalkers being balanced and not simply the best cards to have. They are always going to be cool so long as you don't make them suck, but they don't need to be brokenly overpowered or made into a staple card for the colour.

I use this in my Vish Kal EDH deck which is almost mono black to make use of cabal coffers and black-heavy card draw like necropotence.

If I ever combine this card's -6 ability with debt to the deathless, it will be glorious.

@MattLynn
Why not sorin markov (-3 ability) + sorin's vengeance? That way, you can even stay in mono black.

Posted By: psychichobo (4/10/2013 5:04:55 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
You can always dump the extra mana into shades if you're running mono black and don't have a better plan, I guess. Combo with a couple [Liliana's Shade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana's Shade)s and her +1 ability to thin your deck of a crapload of swamps. Your draw chances ought to improve quite a bit, and the shade will be a very big potential creature before long.  
  
For mono black control: She'll help mutilate cover your board wipes and get around Protection by providing swamps, her -3 ability will allow a more discretionary targeting of Indestructible creatures, and your Murders will then be allowed to take care of softer targets.  
  
She does lack some of the outright power of other planeswalkers, but the combos are most certainly there. The most obvious being any card requiring X mana can be pumped like crazy. Outside of mono black she can shine even more.
posts.html:

Combo with a couple Liliana's Shades and her +1 ability to thin your deck of a crapload of swamps. Your draw chances ought to improve quite a bit, and the shade will be a very big potential creature before long.

For mono black control: She'll help mutilate cover your board wipes and get around Protection by providing swamps, her -3 ability will allow a more discretionary targeting of Indestructible creatures, and your Murders will then be allowed to take care of softer targets.

She does lack some of the outright power of other planeswalkers, but the combos are most certainly there. The most obvious being any card requiring X mana can be pumped like crazy. Outside of mono black she can shine even more.

posts.post_content:
+1 her so you can repeatably:  
 [Raven's Crime](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raven's Crime)  
 [Worm Harvest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worm Harvest)  
 [Waterfront Bouncer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Waterfront Bouncer)  
 [Mind Over Matter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Over Matter)  
 [Mageta the Lion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mageta the Lion)  
 [Jaya Ballard, Task Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jaya Ballard, Task Mage)  
 [Seismic Assault](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seismic Assault)  
  
Of course, you could just smash them long-game with [Cursed Scroll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cursed Scroll).  
  
Ultimate her to cast [Magister Sphinx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magister Sphinx) with [Sorin's Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sorin's Vengeance), which can finish the game that turn...with 4 swamps out.
